creator: mahogarth@ucdavis.edu
text:
See web.xml file below.  Apache fails to start the web app unless the <load-on-
startup> tag set is removed. <load-on-startup> is a valid tag in that position 
per the specification.


-----------------------web.xml--------------------
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<!DOCTYPE web-app PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Web Application 
2.2//EN" "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtds/web-app_2_2.dtd">
<web-app>
	<servlet>
		<servlet-name>JCVSServlet</servlet-name>
		<display-name>jCVS Servlet</display-name>
		<servlet-class>com.ice.jcvslet.JCVSlet</servlet-class>
		<load-on-startup>1</load-on-startup>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>JCVSletConfigDirectory</param-name>
			<param-value>WEB-INF/conf</param-value>
		</init-param>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>JCVSletTempDirectory</param-name>
			<param-value>WEB-INF/temp</param-value>
		</init-param>
		<init-param>
			<param-name>JCVSletWorkDirectory</param-name>
			<param-value>WEB-INF/work</param-value>
		</init-param>
	</servlet>
	<servlet-mapping>
			<servlet-name>JCVSServlet</servlet-name>
			<url-pattern>/JCVSlet/*</url-pattern>
	</servlet-mapping>
</web-app>

Your web.xml file violates the element ordering constraints of the DTD -- see
the Servlet Spec for more details
(http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/download.html)

In particular, the <load-on-startup> element must come *after* initialization
parameters, not *before*.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
